BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: UNITED WAY OF GREATER FALL RIVER INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: UNITED WAY OF GREATER FALL RIVER (UWGFR) IS A LEADER IN THE FIGHT FOR EQUITY AND STRIVES TO CREATE COMMUNITIES WHERE EVERYONE HAS THE RESOURCES, OPPORTUNITIES, AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO THRIVE. UWGFR CHANGES LIVES BY MOBILIZING PEOPLE TO INVEST IN THE COMMUNITY WHERE THEIR RESOURCES ARE NEEDED MOST, AND TO FIGHT FOR THE HEALTH, EDUCATION, FINANCIAL STABILITY OF EVERY PERSON.
IRS990.MissionDesc: UNITED WAY OF GREATER FALL RIVER (UWGFR) IS A LEADER IN THE FIGHT FOR EQUITY AND STRIVES TO CREATE COMMUNITIES WHERE EVERYONE HAS THE RESOURCES, OPPORTUNITIES, AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO THRIVE. BY UNITING ALL SEGMENTS OF THE COMMUNITY THROUGH A WELL-DEVELOPED COMMUNICATIONS AND FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN, UWGFR ENCOURAGES THE PRIVATE SECTOR, INDIVIDUALS, AND CORPORATIONS TO MAINTAIN A MAJOR ROLE IN SUPPORTING INITIATIVES FOCUSED ON REMEDYING PROBLEMS THAT MOST ADVERSELY AFFECT THE LOCAL POPULATION. WE SUPPORT THE DELIVERY OF SERVICES IN THE GREATER FALL RIVER AREA IN THE MOST EFFICIENT AND ECONOMICAL MANNER POSSIBLE BY COLLABORATING WITH PROVIDERS THAT AIM TO CREATE EQUITABLE, LASTING CHANGE THROUGH PREVENTION AND RESILIENCE. UWGFR PROMOTES HIGH GOALS AND PERFORMANCE STANDARDS IN ALL PARTNERS, EVALUATES PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS INDIVIDUALLY AND COLLECTIVELY, AND PREVENTS WASTE AND DUPLICATION OF EFFORT.
IRS990.Desc: DISTRIBUTED 100% OF NET CAMPAIGN TO OVER 80 NON-PROFIT HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE AGENCY PARTNERS THAT PROVIDE VITAL PROGRAM AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO THE MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS WITHIN THE GREATER FALL RIVER AREA. FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE ANNUAL CAMPAIGN, PRIMARY FUNDING WAS ALLOCATED AMONGST 20 APPROVED PROGRAMS WHO UNDERWENT A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM AND FINANCIAL REVIEW; SECONDARY FUNDING WAS PROVIDED TO LOCAL AGENCIES AND PROGRAMS AS DESIGNATED BY DONORS. ADDITIONAL FUNDING FROM DONOR RESTRICTED FUNDS HELD IN OUR ENDOWMENT WAS DISTRIBUTED FOLLOWING A COMPETITIVE GRANT PROCESS TO SUPPORT SPECIAL PROJECTS, PROGRAMS, AND INITIATIVES FACILITATED BY LOCAL NON-PROFIT PARTNERS THAT FOCUS ON HEALTH, EDUCATION, PREVENTION AND TRAINING, FINANCIAL STABILITY, ELDER CARE, SELF-SUFFICIENCY, AND FAMILY RESILIENCE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: INFOLINE: UNITED WAY OF GREATER FALL RIVER (UWGFR) PROVIDES INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICES TO CLIENTS WHO CALL-IN OR WALK-IN TO OUR OFFICE, OR INQUIRE ON OUR WEBSITE WITH FREQUENTLY UPDATED BROCHURES, DIRECTORIES, AND FLYERS DESIGNED TO EDUCATE AND INFORM THE COMMUNITY OF CURRENT RESOURCES AVAILABLE. UWGFR ALSO FUNDS AND CO-SPONSORS MASS 211, AN INFOLINE AND WEBSITE WHICH PROVIDES REAL-TIME INFORMATION AND RESOURCES IN 150 LANGUAGES FOR ESSENTIAL SERVICES, AS WELL AS REFERRALS FOR NON-EMERGENCY CALLS 24/7. SINCE BEING DESIGNATED BY THE MA DPH AND MEMA IN MARCH 2020 AS THE OFFICIAL COVID-19 RESOURCE AND REFERRAL LINE FOR RESIDENTS ACROSS THE COMMONWEALTH, INQUIRIES TO MASS 211 REMAIN AT A STEADY HIGH. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2022, MASS 211 FIELDED 414,575 PHONE CALLS FROM RESIDENTS LIVING IN MUNICIPALITIES ACROSS THE STATE; 15% OF CALLERS CONTINUE TO SEEK INFORMATION DIRECTLY RELATED TO COVID-19, AND 4% OF CALLS SOUGHT HELP FOR MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS, BOTH REPRESENT A DECLINE FROM PRIOR YEAR. IN THE GREATER FALL RIVER AREA, OVER 5,398 CALLS WERE FIELDED BY MASS 211; THE TOP THREE REQUESTS WERE FOR CHILDCARE EXPENSE ASSISTANCE, COVID-19, RENT PAYMENT ASSISTANCE.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OBJECTIVE OF UNITED WAY OF GREATER FALL RIVER'S ENDOWMENT FUND IS TO GENERATE CURRENT INCOME AND LONG-TERM GROWTH. THE INCOME OF THE FUND SHALL BE USED AS DIRECTED: 1. DONOR RESTRICTED FUNDS PROVIDE REVENUE FOR SPECIFIC PROGRAMS OR SERVICES. A PERCENTAGE OF THESE FUNDS, AS ANNUALLY DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE COMMUNITY THROUGH A COMPETITIVE IMPACT GRANT PROCESS. THE AMOUNT RELEASED FOR YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022 WAS $80,686. 2. UNDESIGNATED FUNDS PROVIDE REVENUE TO OFFSET GENERAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES, THUS ALLOWING MORE DONOR DOLLARS TO BE USED FOR PROGRAMS AND SERVICES; OR PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE ANNUAL CAMPAIGN TO ENABLE THE GOAL TO BE REALIZED IN TIMES OF ECONOMIC UPHEAVAL. A PERCENTAGE OF THESE FUNDS AS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS MADE AVAILABLE ANNUALLY. THE AMOUNT RELEASED FOR YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022 WAS $83,510.

GREATER FALL RIVER PARTNER FOR A HEALTHIER COMMUNITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AGENCY PARTNERS ELECTED TO RECEIVE ALLOCATION FUNDING FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE ANNUAL CAMPAIGN UNDERGO A THOROUGH PROGRAM AND BUDGET REVIEW WITH A VOLUNTEER CITIZEN REVIEW PANEL PRIOR TO ALLOCATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDING TO DISCUSS PROGRAMMING AND PRESENT FINANCIAL NEED. DETAILED FINANCIAL REPORTS (WHICH INCLUDE AUDITED OR INDEPENDENTLY PREPARED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS) SUPPORTING PRIOR YEAR ALLOCATIONS ARE REVIEWED DURING THIS PROCESS, FOLLOWED BY AN IN DEPTH, IN-PERSON INTERVIEW WITH AGENCY LEADERSHIP. BI-ANNUAL SERVICE REPORTS OUTLINING PROGRAM OUTCOMES ARE ALSO REQUIRED, ALONG WITH PERIODIC UPDATES DICTATED BY UNFORESEEN CHANGES IN HOW PROGRAMS ARE ADMINISTERED. COMPETITIVE FUNDING FOR IMPACT AND FOOD GRANTS REQUIRE BUDGET REVIEW, AND ANNUAL REPORTS OUTLINING PROGRAM METRICS AND OUTCOMES, AS WELL AS TOTAL FUND EXPENDITURES. ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE VETTED BY VOLUNTEER REVIEW COMMITTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE BY A MEMBER OF THE ACCOUNTING FIRM. IT IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REVIEWED ANNUALLY, CONSIDERED FOR ANY CHANGES OR AMENDMENTS, AND THEN IS DISTRIBUTED TO ALL STAFF AND DIRECTORS FOR THEIR REVIEW. THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DAY-TO-DAY MONITORING OF CONFLICTS. WHERE THE CHIEF PROFESSIONAL OFFICER IS CONCERNED, RELATIVE TO CONFLICTS, THE CHIEF VOLUNTEER OFFICER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING HIS/HER ACTIONS. ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND STAFF SIGN OFF ON THIS POLICY, EACH YEAR, DISCLOSING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, AND ACKNOWLEDGING THAT THEY HAVE REVIEWED THE POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A POLICY HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED WHEREBY THE CHIEF PROFESSIONAL OFFICER WILL BE REVIEWED (AND COMPENSATION CONSIDERED) BY A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, AS A SUB COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, CONSISTING OF THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR AND THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE CHAIR. ALL AVAILABLE COMPARABLE COMPENSATION DATA - BOTH LOCAL AND REGIONAL - IS UTILIZED IN THE EVALUATION. ANY COMPENSATION, INCLUDING SALARY AND BENEFITS ARE APPROVED BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL FORMS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND ALL OTHER POLICIES AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC IN THE UNITED WAY OFFICE DURING REGULAR BUSINESS HOURS. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE THROUGH GUIDESTAR.ORG AND THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS DIVISION OF PUBLIC CHARITIES. GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE VIA THE SECRETARY FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS CORPORATE DATABASE. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION'S BALANCE SHEET IS INCLUDED IN THE ANNUAL REPORT, WHICH IS WIDELY DISTRIBUTED IN THE COMMUNITY, AND THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 ARE PUBLISHED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.

THE AUDIT COMMITTEE PROVIDES OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM. THE MEMBERS OF THIS COMMITTEE, ALL OF WHOM HAVE FINANCIAL BACKGROUNDS, CONSIST OF THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD, CHAIR OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND THE TREASURER. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE MEETS INDEPENDENTLY WITH THE CPA FIRM PRIOR TO THE AUDIT BEING PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
